noun.description: Socially unconventional, artistic people and the areas they frequent, viewed collectively.
examples: Frances couch-surfs around what remains of New York City's bohemia
one of the legendary figures of London's literary bohemia

proper noun.description: A region that forms the western part of the Czech Republic. Formerly a Slavic kingdom, it became a province in the newly formed Czechoslovakia by the Treaty of Versailles in 1919.

origin: Mid 19th century: from bohemian, on the model of Bohemia.
